text: Backlog z Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Dość ciężkie, słodowe, męczące.
On draft at Bells. Poured murky red with thin off white head. Berries, sour grape, cherries, wood. Tart, dry finish. Great stuff.
[5/13/17] Draught at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Green session. Amber. Fruitiness, wine, caramel, tart, a bit of sweetness, wood.
Sample at MBCC 2017. Amber with a small head. Aroma of berries, some funk and light vinegar. Similar taste, also some grass. The body was fairly light.
Sample at MBCC 2017. Tart and fruity smell with red berries. Similar taste, acidic. Spritsy mouthfeel with a high carbonation.
Keg at cbc17... Copper.. Thin tan lacing.. Soft funk fruit.. Big berries.. Funk fruit
Tap @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration, 2017. Pours clear golden with a white head. Dusty hops, brett and caramel. Medium bodied.
Provad MBCC-17. Doft och smak av körsbär, plommon, farinsocker, ek och körsbärskärnor. Snäll vinägerton. Stiltypisk snygg röd suris.
Tap @MBCC2017, Green Session. Light golden brown, offwhite head. Malty aroma, light dried fruit and port. Sweetish, fruity and malty flavpur, orange. Port sweetness.
Fat på MBCC 2017. Mörk bärnstensfärgad. Doft och smak av körsbär, plommon, farinsocker, ek och körsbärskärnor. Snäll vinägerton. Stiltypisk röd suris.
Tap at mbcc17, copenhagen. Reddish brown color, tanned head. Aroma has cherries, port, oak. Nice sweet port notes on taste, some tart notes, some cherries.
Sampled @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017, Green Session. Klare dunkel goldene Farbe. Geruch ist säuerlich fruchtig, rote Beeren, Trauben. Geschmack nach roten Trauben, Beeren, leicht säuerlich.

13.05.2017, tap @ MBCC:
Nice slightly fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry sour-ish mineraly, soda powder, sorrel, oak, fruit stones, bloodlike minerals, grass, old citrus peel, caramel malts, berry skin. Taste is slightly sweet sour-ish, soda powder, sap, oak, grass, old citrus peel, minerals, berry skin, caramel malts, fruit stones. Medium bitterness, slightly dry sour-ish mouthfeel. Fair enough.

Pours caramel with a low white head. Aromas of almond, cherries, citrus, raspberries. Taste is fruity and floral with light funky notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with moderate carbonation and somewhat dry.

On draft at Roll Out the Barrel 2016. The pour is a darker red brown with s thin cap of white head and no lace. The aroma is sour and vinous with a nice grape and bright fruit offering. There is a light tartness and a moderate sour presence. No real barnyard, but its decently crisp and light. The flavor is definitely funky. There is a light grape sour happening, but there is a sweet maltiness to it as well. The port adds a nice woodiness on the back end. The mouth feel is thin and light with a watery thin carbonation and a less than desirable finish. Meh.

Sample at Roll Out the Barrel 2016. Aroma is port, wood, tart, dark fruit, yummy. Appearance is brown orange, light tan head, mostly hazy. Taste is barrel, port, wheat, tart, dark fruit, good. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, port barrel aftertaste. Overall, this is tasty.

Draft to taster at the Eccentric Cafe. Looks solid; a cloudy caramelish orange with foamy off-white head. Smells semi-sweet, tart, and mildly funky alongside notes of port and oak. Tastes like it smells, but less balanced, with a medium-bodied mouthfeel that finishes semi-dry. Solid, but smells better than it tastes.
